moves.title: Grab
changes: Normalized IASA to the rest of the cast (30 > 31)

moves.title: Fireball (Neutral Special)
changes: Lifespan reduced to properly match GFX (260 > 72)

moves.title: Falcon Dive (Up Special)
changes: Removed Bucket Brake

moves.title: Grab
changes: Normalized IASA to the rest of the cast (30 > 31)

moves.title: Forward Throw
changes: Fixed bug where Donkey Kong’s cargo grab release applied double momentum

moves.title: Spinning Kong (Up Special)
changes: Removed Bucket Brake

moves.title: Grab
changes: Nana/CPU controlled Ice Climber pair throws without considering human input

moves.title: Counter (Down Special)
changes: Now uses intangibility instead of invincibility when activated, matching other counters

moves.title: General
changes: Fixed a bug where Jigglypuff's hurtbox did not properly update when entering crouch or landing, resulting in her being hit in scenarios when she should not

moves.title: Ledge roll
changes: Ledge roll occupancy matched to cast (40 > 45)

moves.title: Getup attack (up)
changes: Hitbox size reduced (10 > 5)

moves.title: Bucket (Down Special)
changes: Can no longer turn around while putting away the bucket

moves.title: Ledge roll
changes: Ledge roll occupancy matched to cast (40 > 45)

moves.title: Bomb (Down Special)
changes: Now activates on shield

moves.title: Up Special (Spin Attack)
changes: First active frame changed to properly match previous changelogs (8 > 7)

moves.title: Alternative stage slots are accessible using the Wiimote and Nunchuck

changes.title: Hold B on a Wiimote with a direction to get the GameCube equivalent of an option
changes: B+Left = GC L
B+Up = GC R
B+Right = GC Z
B+Down = GC X
A = GC R
C = GC X
- = GC X
-&+ together = GC Y

changes.title: (R-alt) Lunar Battlefield
changes: Received a visual update

changes.title: (Base Slot) Castle Siege PM
changes: Reverted to Project M's Castle Siege, moved from the Z slot

changes.title: (R-alt) Castle Siege of Time
changes: Moved from the default slot due to Temple of Time taking its layout

changes.title: (Z-alt) Castlefield
changes: Moved from the R-alt

changes.title: (Base Slot) Ceres Space Colony
changes: A new aesthetic for Metroid Lab, this stage takes its slot and position on the SSS

changes.title: (R-alt) Ceres Husk
changes: A new 1:1 of Frigate Husk, with Ceres Space Colony's aesthetic

changes.title: (Z-alt) Ceres X
changes: Takes the visual revamp from the base slot

changes.title: (L-alt) Majora's Room (NEW!)
changes: A 1:1 of Battlefield

changes.title: (Z-alt) Great Bay
changes: Moved from Hyrule Castle's Z-alt

changes.title: (R-alt) Sauria FoD
changes: Received a visual overhaul

changes.title: (Z-alt) Space Colony Ark
changes: Received a new Z alt: Space Colony Ark, a 1:1 of Sky Santuary Zone

changes.title: (Z-alt) Cheese Bridge
changes: Received a new Z alt: Cheese Bridge, a unique casual stage with hazards

changes.title: (Base) Frigate Husk
changes: A completely new stage, taking the slot of Frigate Orpheon. This is the same stage collision-wise as the custom stage Hyrule Meadows.

changes.title: (R-alt) Drowned Frigate
changes: A 1:1 of Frigate Husk

changes.title: (Z-alt) Frigate Orpheon
changes: Moved to the Z-alt from the base slot

changes.title: (Base) Green Hill Zone
changes: A visual overhaul of the Project M classic, based on its appearance in Sonic Generations.

changes.title: (R-alt) Green Hill Zone PM
changes: The previous base stage has been moved to the R-alt

changes.title: (L-alt) Marble Zone
changes: Moved to the L-alt from the R-alt slot

changes.title: (X-alt) Green Hill Zone Brawl (NEW!)
changes: Moved to the X-alt from the L-alt slot

changes.title: (Z-alt) Kakariko Village
changes: A new alt, which is a 1:1 of Smashville

changes.title: (R-alt) Kongo Jungle Land
changes: Received a visual update

changes.title: (Base) Luigi's Mansion (Competitive)
changes: A new competitive layout for Luigi's Mansion, with some visual updates from the existing custom stage

changes.title: (R-alt) Deck Dry Bones
changes: A 1:1 of Luigi's Mansion Competitive

changes.title: (Z-alt) Luigi's Mansion
changes: Moved to the Z-alt from the base slot

changes.title: (R-alt) Mushroomy Kingdom Cavern
changes: Received a new R-alt, a 1:1 of Metal Cavern

changes.title: (R-alt) Pictochat of Time
changes: Changed aesthetics to mirror Temple of Time, the stage which now has this layout

changes.title: General
changes: Moved to an EX slot to allow Temple of Time to be selectable on Random

changes.title: (Z-alt) RidleyLand
changes: Moved from Frigate Orpheon’s R-alt

changes.title: (Base Slot) Sky Sanctuary Zone
changes: Received a complete visual overhaul, based on its appearance in Sonic Generations

changes.title: (Z) Sky Sanctuary Husk (NEW!)
changes: A new 1:1 of Frigate Husk based on the visually revamped Sky Santuary Zone

changes.title: (X-alt) Sky Sanctuary Zone (Original)
changes: Moved from the base slot due to the visual revamp replacing it

changes.title: (Z-alt) Underworld
changes: Received a complete visual overhaul

changes.title: (R-alt) Hyrule's Courtyard Mansion
changes: Received a new R-alt, a 1:1 of Luigi's Mansion

changes.title: (Base Slot) Temple of Time
changes: A completely new aesthetic for Castle Siege's collisions! This stage is based on the Twilight Princess iteration of the Temple of Time

changes.title: (R-alt) OoT Temple of Time
changes: A 1:1 of Temple of Time; can you find the secrets that lie within this stage?

changes.title: (L-alt) Bridge of Eldin (Platforms)
changes: A casual stage, which has platforms teleported in frequently!

changes.title: (Z-alt) Bridge of Eldin
changes: Moved from Clock Town's Z-alt

changes.title: (Base) Yoshi’s Island (Competitive)
changes: A new layout for Yoshi's Island intended for competitive play, with some minor visual improvements from the custom stage it is based on

changes.title: (R-alt) New Yoshi’s Island
changes: A 1:1 of the competitive Yoshi's Island layout

changes.title: (Z-alt) Yoshi’s Island (PM)
changes: Moved from the base slot

moves.title: Characters and Gameplay
changes: Fixed issues with CPU and replays where a player could hold the shoulder button or C-stick during replays to manipulate behavior
Replays will no longer break when they are used with Wiimotes, Nunchucks, or Classic Controllers
L-Load characters can be accessed again with Wiimotes and Nunchucks using the minus and C buttons, respectively.

Updated FitSonic.pac and FitKnuckles.pac to remove unnecessary common loaded textures which caused crashes and graphical glitches related to any other move that also referenced those smoke textures (this bug has existed for about 9 years)

moves.title: Stages/Music
changes: Jungle Japes has fixes for the Klap Trap’s eyes

moves.title: Other
changes: Song titles for songs loaded directly from Brawl pop up correctly during replays
Fixed an issue where unplugging a controller on the character or stage select screens had a chance of crashing the game

moves.title: Costumes
changes: Bowser’s Z-alt (Dark Bowser) has received a visual revamp
Wolf02 costume has been updated. Previously, this costume had duplicate face textures to account for transparency issues; these transparency texture issues have now been fixed
Fixed minor cosmetic issues on OoT Link
OoT Sheik model and recolors updated for visual clarity
Updated OoT Ganondorf model and recolors, with a new Melee-inspired recolor
New Ivysaur Z-alt: Saurceress Ivysaur
Kirby received two new recolors: Orange Fighter Kirby and Sepia Cowboy Kirby
Updated Shogun Dedede model to improve performance; Shogun Dedede also has separate minion projectiles for his Side Special
Improved visuals for the default Waddle Doo design
New model for Dedede’s mask taunt
Commander Lucas has a new white recolor
Revamped Earthbound 64 Lucas alt and recolors added
Knuckles’ Hydrocity (Cyan) and Sandopolis (Yellow) recolors updated to better match his other ones

moves.title: Character Polish
changes: Peach now has her 5th idle animation as well as grounded throw transition (Aerial Down Special) animations re-added. They were previously removed due to memory restrictions that are no longer applicable
Peach’s vegetables have been normalized in terms of coloration
Yoshi eggshell effects now match individual costumes instead of always being blank
Ganondorf has received a new set of renders
Kirby has received a new set of renders

moves.title: Other
changes: Due to intended improved replay compatibility, one player matches will no longer skip the countdown announcement. This code has been moved to the Extras folder, but it will break replays if included
Added animated CSS code for modding support; the main CSS background model has also been adjusted to no longer contain the fake slots, allowing for easier background swaps

Updated custom soundbank code to not crash when two custom soundbanks load at the same time. This fixes an issue where rare freezes would occur in modes such as All-Star Vs. when a character with a custom soundbank appeared while another with a different custom soundbank was playing a sound in-battle
Changed the Knuckles soundbank from 176.sawnd to 146.sawnd and adjusted Knuckles’ yelling during his Final Smash
Fixed the position of showing 100 KO stars on the character select screen
The audio fade code featured in Project M has been readded; the code was rebuilt to prevent previous issues
Adjusted volume for Ballad of the Goddess, Jungle Bump, and House Special tracks
R-alt costumes are now accessible with a Nunchuck by holding C (Z-alt costumes were already accessible)
Classic Controller and Nunchuck control options can now access the custom controls menu on the character select screen
Revamped to use Sammi Husky’s new file patch code, vastly improving load times

Adjusted how memory reservation works in the stage param files to better match how Brawl treated stages. This allows the stage Mario Bros. to be placed wherever desired without requiring it to be coded into a specific slot.
It is now possible to customize stages to use two pac files based on param settings, in a similar manner to Castle Siege
Dual Pac stages that were based around a single “dummy” pac file as the secondary load no longer require this and work as expected
Multiple stages have renamed files to help with consistent file structure

Page 3 of the stage selection screen will now dynamically display either a return to page 1 button or custom stages depending on if there are custom stage builder stages on the SD card. This helps eliminate an issue where builds that chose to not have any would show the incorrect button or require swapping the texture assets around
Control customization on the CSS has been re-coded, and now plays SFX when doing actions such as opening the menu or pinning a tag

Added code which allows passive stage props to exist which do not affect players and projectiles (or just projectiles) directly. This feature is currently unused but is provided for custom stage design purposes in the future
Strap and Results screens updated for version 2.4
